snippet: The former baseball commissioner PETER V. UEBERROTH, again rejecting overtures from Republican kingmakers, has ruled out running for the United States Senate in California, declaring that a bruising multimillion-dollar race would be "a waste of mo...
lead_paragraph: The former baseball commissioner PETER V. UEBERROTH, again rejecting overtures from Republican kingmakers, has ruled out running for the United States Senate in California, declaring that a bruising multimillion-dollar race would be "a waste of money." The 54-year-old Ueberroth, who also achieved prominence for his stewardship of the financially successful 1984 Olympics in Los Angeles, made the announcement Friday only minutes before a filing deadline.

headline.main: Ueberroth Makes The Call: I'm Out!
